moves.1. e4: ..this is one of those games that you see something that has a bit of interest...and ya decide to go all chips in for a laugh...ish..
moves.7... Be7 8. O-O Nc6 9. h3: ..in blitz games I like when h3 appears on the radar..if you get your pieces right..it an interesting sac ...(Bxh3)
moves.9... Be6 10. b3: ..not sure of white plan here...Bb2 would be blocked ..
moves.10... Rc8 11. Be3 Nb4 12. Na4 O-O: ..no..i dont know why i did not play Rxc2...but i sometime play moves quickly at work...
moves.13. c3 Nc6 14. Nb6: ..I decided that I'll take a closer look at h3..sac the exchange and see what happens...
..if only my bishop were on d8...sigh...a trapped piece would have been caught...
moves.19... e4: ..looking to soften up the king pawns...
moves.21. bxc4 Ne5: ..this is where i wondered if Nf3+ would lead to some winning fun. gxf Qxh3 and how does white deal with either fxe f3 or exf from black mating in one..
moves.22. Qd5+: ...damn you Queen..! Nf3 is still on the mind...
moves.22... Kh8 23. Qxe4 f3: ..gxf leads to Nf3+ with Rf6-h6 and Qxh3 coming soon...
moves.24. Bd4: ..white is looking to take the knight so better stir it up...Go pawn..
moves.24... fxg2 25. Kxg2 Rf3: ..from here I am thinking black is won. The queen and rook will be a serious headache and white must give up its powerful bishop for the equally strong knight...
moves.26. Bxe5 Qxh3+: ...intermediate move...development while attacking is always good....
moves.27. Kg1 dxe5 28. Rcd1 Rf4: ..just want to get the Queen offside...
moves.29. Rd3 Rg4+: ..oh look..a little check..and with a bit of planned foresight ..Black arriving into the end game a piece up.....
moves.36. Kf3 h5:
..g5 is following and black marches the king to support the incoming queens..
Lucky tactic to be honest but its spotting them is the point..
